* Bill de hOra <bill@...> [2008-09-11 18:50]:
> There's too much deployed web infrastructure that scales on the
> basis of connections being released and requests being short
> lived things. Like load balancers. It doesn't abstract away
> easily.

That’s not the same argument: you went from N=1 to N>>1. So that
is a good point. I do have to wonder whether a less drastic
measure than switching protocols (like switching ports, or some
such) wouldn’t (mostly(?)) suffice as evasive manoeuvre, though.

Regards,
--
